item.title: [DEV-5464] FE - Location Filters
item.description:
�� Location

  • Label: Location suitable for
  • Multi-select input field: Dropdown contains the name of all of the host’s venues in alphabetical order
  • Placeholder: Select venue(s)
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that have a guest radius + 50% which includes at least one of the selected venues.
  • Note: If a venue was deleted, don’t show it in the dropdown and don’t show it in the input field if it was selected in the past (edit screen).

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5463] FE - [Temporary] Ensure that the LeadFeed looks up the users filterset and applies it to the main page
item.description:
Since we’re changing the behaviour of the enquiriesPage query to not automatically the users preferences, we need to ensure that until we add the option to select which filter you’re applying, we look up the first (and only) filterset and include it in the query

This ticket becomes redundant once https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5413 is completed
item.summary: FE - [Temporary] Ensure that the LeadFeed looks up the users filterset and applies it to the main page

item.title: [DEV-5458] FE - Date Filter Attribute
item.description:
�� Dates

  • Label: Days
  • Input field label: Days
  • Multi-select input field: Dropdown contains the days of the week in chronological order (Mondays, Tuesdays etc.)
  • Placeholder: Select day(s)
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that start on one of the selected weekdays. For multi-day leads do the same and also use the start day. Show flexible leads regardless of the selected weekdays.
  • Input field label: Months
  • Multi-select input field: Dropdown contains the months of the year in chronological order
  • Placeholder: Select month(s)
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that start in one of the selected months. For multi-day leads do the same and also use the start day. Only show flexible leads that start in one of the selected months.

item.description:

  • Label: Location suitable for

  • Placeholder: Select venue(s)

item.title: [DEV-5450] Host Home - Necessary changes
item.description:
Because we are changing the concept of preferences and filters we need to adapt the Host Home:

Insights panel

  • Preferences: Currently, the insights panel is limited by a host’s preferences if they have at least one venue. Once the new filter are live the insights panel should no longer be limited by the host's preferences and only by their venues' locations.
  • Copy change: The copy that appears on hover over the info icon should be changed to: All leads in your area that came in yesterday.

Host Home tasks

  • Preferences task condition: Task should be done if at least one filter that isn’t one of the default ones exist. This could be the migrated one. It should also be done if one of the default ones is edited by the host.
  • Copy change: Set up your preferences → Create your first filter
  • Copy change: Follow us on LinkedIn → Check out our LinkedIn

Note: These changes should not affect the current don/not done state of any tasks.

status.description: A list of unrefined tickets and drafts. Tickets are not ready to be worked on.

comments.comment: Kai SalmonAdditional ticket here. Let me know your thoughts on the preference task condition. SOme of the copy might still change today.

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5446] Update Enquiries Page Query to take in a Filterset id and apply using FAD
item.description:
server/src/primaryAdapters/graphQL/resolvers/_queries/enquiry.ts

remove 

const usersFilter = notificationPrefs
    ? {
        ...filter,
        maxGuestsCount: notificationPrefs.maxCapacity,
        minBudget: notificationPrefs.minBudget,
        collectionIds: notificationPrefs.eventTypeIds,
      }
    : filter

update EnquiryFiltersInput to accept a FilterId
item.summary: Update Enquiries Page Query to take in a Filterset id and apply using FAD

item.title: [DEV-5445] Ensure that the email addresses used are those from the filters table not the hosts table, and ensure that the emails are unique, and multiple email addresses are supported
item.summary: Ensure that the email addresses used are those from the filters table not the hosts table, and ensure that the emails are unique, and multiple email addresses are supported

item.title: [DEV-5444] Rewrite `sendNewEnquiryNotifications` to use the filter attribute dictionary (FAD)
item.description:
Don’t forget to check if the filterSet is active and not deleted!

Sending notifications

Once a new brief goes to the Lead Feed the following checks should happen:

  • Is the lead in any of the host’s venue’s catchment area? → Yes
  • Does the lead match at least one filter? → Yes
  • How many of those filters have notifications enables? → One or more

→ Send one email to each recipient on the matching filters

For the contents of the Email see: https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5438

More detailed decision tree is attached to the ticket.
item.summary: Rewrite `sendNewEnquiryNotifications` to use the filter attribute dictionary (FAD)

item.title: [DEV-5443] Create a function which, using the FAD, maps an filterset to a enquiry where clause
item.description:
Ensure deleted filterSets are handled correctly

Note: only the FAD attributes who’s value in the given FilterSet is null should be fired 

const FAD = {
  MinBudget: {
    getEnquiryFilter: (hostPreferences) => ({
      budget: {
        [Op.gt]: hostPreferences.MinBudget,
      },
    }),
    getFilterSetFilter: (enquiry) => ({
      MinBudget: {
        [Op.lt]: enquiry.budget,
      },
    }),
  },
  MaxBudget: {
    getEnquiryFilter: (hostPreferences) => ({
      budget: {
        [Op.lt]: hostPreferences.MaxBudget,
      },
    }),
    getFilterSetFilter: (enquiry) => ({
      MaxBudget: {
        [Op.gt]: enquiry.budget,
      },
    }),
  },
}

/* 
    example for enquiry filter GIVEN a host prefernce 

    iterate through all *NOT NULL* keys in host preferneces 
    getEnquiryFilter for each
    apend to an array
*/

const filterSet = {MaxBudget: 10000, MinBudget: null}
const enqWhere = {
  [Op.and]: [
    {budget: {[Op.gt]: 10000}}
  ]
}
item.summary: Create a function which, using the FAD, maps an filterset to a enquiry where clause

item.title: [DEV-5441] Create the dictionary of filter attribute to where clauses, for existing filter types
item.description:
Existing filters

  • Min Budget
  • Max Capacity
  • Event Types

Pseudo Code

Note: Pseudo code is set up for MinBudget and MaxBudget for illustrative purposes. This ticket should use minBudget maxCapacity and event_type_ids

const FAD = {
  MinBudget: {
    getEnquiryFilter: (hostPreferences) => ({
      budget: {
        [Op.gt]: hostPreferences.MinBudget,
      },
    }),
    getFilterSetFilter: (enquiry) => ({
      MinBudget: {
        [Op.lt]: enquiry.budget,
      },
    }),
  },
  MaxBudget: {
    getEnquiryFilter: (hostPreferences) => ({
      budget: {
        [Op.lt]: hostPreferences.MaxBudget,
      },
    }),
    getFilterSetFilter: (enquiry) => ({
      MaxBudget: {
        [Op.gt]: enquiry.budget,
      },
    }),
  },
}
item.summary: Create the dictionary of filter attribute to where clauses, for existing filter types

item.title: [DEV-5440] Restructure `notification_preferences` table into a `filtersets` table
item.description:
{{user_id }} to no longer be primary key
add a new primary key (filter id)
Add a name column

Remove all constraints

Migration:

  • Name: Previous preferences
  • Min budget → Budget with value and minimum budget selected
  • Max capacity → Max guests
  • Event type → Event type
  • Notifications → Notifications with account email as the recipient
  • All other filter attributes should remain empty

Add a deletedAt column, and ensure Sequelize does not return deleted filterSets

Think about multiple emails: See linked ticket

ENSURE THAT EXISTING MUTATIONS STILL WORK (e.g. findNotificationPreferenceByUserId)

Interested guests page copy changes (ignore copy inconsistencies in the designs, please):

  • Subtitle: [x] Contact Details Received → [x] contact details received
  • Table header: Guest Details → Guest details
  • Button copy: Guest Details → Guest details

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5438] Notifications - Email copy updates
item.description:
We want to use this opportunity to update the copy of the emails we are sending out to our hosts.

Note: Wherever an event type is used, use “event” for “Something else” events.

New lead notification

  • Subject: ��️ Lead Feed - New [event type] lead
  • Headline: New [event type] lead you’ll love in the Lead Feed ��
    * Copy: A new lead matches your filters. Head to the Lead Feed now and send a message if it’s a good fit for your venue. 
    Remember, each enquiry can only receive 8 messages from venues so check it out now to make sure you don't miss out.
  • Blue button (links to the messaging page of lead): View the lead
  • Link (links to filters page): Manage your filters
  • Included data: Event type, link to messaging page

In future we might want to inlude the name of the filter(s) this lead matches or lead details of the brief. Listing the filter names becomes really interesting in combination with notifications being sent to multiple email addresses per filter.

New match notification

  • Subject: ♥️ Lead Feed - New match with [Guest name]
  • Headline: [Guest name] matched with [venue name] - Get in touch now ♥️
  • Copy: After receiving your Lead Feed message, [Guest name] wants to hear more about your venue. Refresh your memory on their [event type] enquiry and contact them to discuss next steps.
    Remember, you can close this lead your way, commission-free. ��
  • Blue button (links to guest details page): View the details
  • Included data: Link to guest details page, guest’s first name, event type, venue name

New direct enquiry notification

  • Subject: �� New direct enquiry - [Guest name] wants to hear from you
  • Headline: [Guest name] is interested in [venue name] - Get in touch now ��
  • Copy: After seeing your HeadBox listing, [Guest name] wants to hold their [event type] at [venue name]. Take a look at their enquiry and get back to them to discuss next steps.
  • Blue button (links to guest details page): View the details
  • Included data: Link to guest details page, guest’s first name, event type, venue name

New listing notification

Note: This email is still using a very old tempalte and needs to be updated. Kill that teal HB logo!

  • Subject: �� Listing now live - [Space name] at [venue name]
    * Headline: Your listing is now live  on HeadBox ��
  • Copy: [Space name] at [venue name] is now listed on HeadBox. For tips on how to make the most of your listing check out our help article.
  • Note: “check out our help article” links to https://headbox.ladesk.com/896806-HOST-How-to-make-the-most-out-of-your-listing
  • Blue button (links to public listing): View your listing
  • Included data: Link to public listing, venue name, space name

Design

https://www.figma.com/file/bg9v4YPAVYpvCcTJt2X9gZ/Lead-Feed-Filters?node-id=303%3A14236

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software

comments.comment:
Ellen Schmucker have done the dev work to update the copy of the first three email types.

The New listing notification is either hb-venues-management or redbox that controls this email. Will investigate it now

Finished the listing notification, it is an old template but there was just a parameter setting the teal logo.

That said I think it’s still a red button though unless we change the template used but I’m pretty certain it’s used a lot elsewhere so don’t want to edit it.

item.title: [DEV-5426] Notifications - Settings and trigger
item.description:
We want to give our hosts the opportunity to activate notifications per filter so they only receive notifications that are really valuable.

Filter form on create filter page

  • Label: Notifications
  • Toggle
    • Default: Off
    • Label: Receive email notifications for every lead that matches this filter.
    • Click on toggle or label switches the toggle.
  • Input field
    • Label: Notifications will be sent to
    • Input field prefilled with the email address of user account
    • Subtitle: Separate multiple email addresses with commas.
    • Note: We want to give the host the possibility to add more than one email address. Use whatever is easiest and provides adequate usability.

Sending notifications

Once a new brief goes to the Lead Feed the following checks should happen:

  • Is the lead in any of the host’s venue’s catchment area? → Yes
  • Does the lead match at least one filter? → Yes
  • How many of those filters have notifications enables? → One or more

→ Send one email to each recipient on the matching filters

For the contents of the Email see: https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5438

More detailed decision tree is attached to the ticket.

In future we might want to include the name of the filter(s) this lead matches or lead details of the brief. Listing the filter names becomes realy interesting in combination with notifications being sent to multiple email addresses per filter.

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

comments.comment: Kai Salmon Added comment in orange about flexibility for multi email input field implementation ��

item.description:

item.title: [DEV-5424] Filters - Default filters
item.description:
To demonstrate our hosts how versatile the new filter attributes are we want to give every host three default filters in addition to the migrated filter. The filters can be edited, duplicated and deleted like any other filters and should be selectable on the Lead Feed.

Create the following filter sets for every host

Filter 1

  • Name: Weekday events
  • Days: Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays
  • Notifications: off

Filter 2

  • Name: Summer weddings
  • Months: June, July, August,
  • Event type: Wedding
  • Notifications off

Filter 3

  • Name: Over 100 guests
  • Capacity: min guests 100
  • Notifications: off

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

comments.comment: Kai Salmon We adapted one of the default filters.
Ellen Schmucker Can we discuss how we want to handle this with incremental delivery?

item.title: [DEV-5423] Filters - Filter attributes
item.description:
With this update we want to expand the filter attributes that can be selected when creating a filter and are used to filter the Lead Feed.

It is not mandatory to select values for all filter attributes. Therefore if an attribute doesn’t have any values it won’t be used for filtering.

�� Location

  • Label: Location suitable for
  • Multi-select input field: Dropdown contains the name of all of the host’s venues in alphabetical order
  • Placeholder: Select venue(s)
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that have a guest radius + 50% which includes at least one of the selected venues.
  • Note: If a venue was deleted, don’t show it in the dropdown and don’t show it in the input field if it was selected in the past (edit screen).

�� Budget

  • Label: Budget
  • Currency input field: Currency dependent on the host’s country
  • Radio button: Minimum budget (Default) / Minimum spend per head
  • Validation: If something else than a number is entered show error message: Please enter a number or leave blank
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that have a budget that exceeds the minimum spend (per head) entered here.

�� Capacity

  • Label: Capacity
  • Input field with person icon: Minimum guests
  • Input field with person icon: Maximum guests
  • Validation: If something else than a number is entered show error message: Please enter a number or leave blank
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads with a number of guests that falls between the min. and max. number.

�� Dates

  • Label: Days
  • Input field label: Days
  • Multi-select input field: Dropdown contains the days of the week in chronological order (Mondays, Tuesdays etc.)
  • Placeholder: Select day(s)
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that start on one of the selected weekdays. For multi-day leads do the same and also use the start day. Show flexible leads regardless of the selected weekdays.
  • Input field label: Months
  • Multi-select input field: Dropdown contains the months of the year in chronological order
  • Placeholder: Select month(s)
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that start in one of the selected months. For multi-day leads do the same and also use the start day. Only show flexible leads that start in one of the selected months.

���� Event types

  • Label: Event types
  • Checkbox group with all event types in alphabetical order
  • Note: A click on the checkbox or the even type label should change its state.
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Only show leads that match one of the selected event types

�� Facilities

  • Label: Facilities
  • Copy: Exclude leads that request...
  • Checkbox group with all facilities in alphabetical order
  • Note: A click on the checkbox or the facility label should change its state.
  • Validation: None
  • Filter behaviour: Don’t show leads that have ticket any of the selected facilities.

Design

  • Figma https://www.figma.com/file/bg9v4YPAVYpvCcTJt2X9gZ/Lead-Feed-Filters

status.description: A list of unrefined tickets and drafts. Tickets are not ready to be worked on.

comments.comment: Kai Salmon I’ve added an info icon to the location and some more behaviour to the date filters.
Location should be filtered using the guest radius +50%.

item.title: [DEV-5422] Filters - Current preference migration
item.description:
Currently, our hosts can create one filter with the following attributes: Min budget, max capacity, event type, notifications on/off. We want to migrate these old preferences set into a new filter so they don’t get lost and the host can still edit them if they want to.

Convert a hosts current preferences to a new filter if at least one of following is true:

  • Min budget filled in
  • Max capacity filled in
  • At least on event type selected
  • Notifications active

Delete all filterSets which have:

  • min budget null, and
  • max capacity null, and
  • event type empty, and
  • notifications false

Migration:

  • Name: Previous preferences
  • Min budget → Budget with value and minimum budget selected
  • Max capacity → Max guests
  • Event type → Event type
  • Notifications → Notifications with account email as the recipient
  • All other filter attributes should remain empty

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5420] Filters - "Create filter" page
item.description:
Clicking on the “Create new filter” button on the template filter navigates to this new page.

  • Link copy: < Go back to filters
  • Headline copy: Create new Lead Feed filter
  • Subtitle: Select criteria to narrow down the leads on your Feed.
  • Input field:
    • Label: Name of filter
    • Placeholder: Name
    • Validation: None unless we need a max. length for the database not to fall over.
  • [Filter attributes]

Save

  • Primary Button: Save filter
  • A click on this button saves the filter and directs the user to the filter overview.
  • There the new filter appears on the top of the table and the “last edited” date is filled with the current date.

Discard

  • Secondary Button: Discard
  • A click on this button opens a confirmation modal if the user has entered any information in any of the input fields.
  • “Go back to filter” closes the modal and “Discard filter” sends the user back to the filter overview.
  • Confirmation modal copy: Are you sure you want to discard this filter?
  • Left link copy: Go back to filter
  • Right primary Button: Discard filter

Validation

  • Save validation: At least one filter attribute has to be selected or notifications activated to be able to save the filter. If this is not the case display error: Please fill in at least one filter attribute or activate notifications.

Design

  • Figma https://www.figma.com/file/bg9v4YPAVYpvCcTJt2X9gZ/Lead-Feed-Filters?node-id=219%3A9542
  • For modals check out “Create template” screen

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [DEV-5419] Filters - "Your filters" page - Delete
item.description:
It should be possible to delete any filter.

  • A click on the “Delete” link in the filter table opens a confirmation modal.
  • Confirmation modal copy: Are you sure you want to delete the filter “[Name of filter]?
  • Left link copy (closes the modal): Back
  • Right primary Button: Delete filter
  • A click on “Delete filter” deletes the filter and opens a confirmation message:
  • Confirmation message copy: Your filter “[filter name]” has been deleted
  • Link copy: Back to templates

Design

  • See templates delete functionality

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5418] Filters - "Your filters" page - Duplicate
item.description:
It should be possible to duplicate any filter:

  • A click on the “Duplicate” link in the filter table duplicates the template.
  • The new template should appear at the top of the list.
  • The suffix “copy” should be added to the name of the template. e.g. “Party template copy”
  • All actions should be available for the new template - edit, delete, duplicate

Design

  • See templates duplicate functionality

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5417] Filters - "Your filters" page - Edit
item.description:
It should be possible to edit any filter.

  • A click on the “Edit” link in the filter table opens the edit page in the same tab.
  • The page is the same as the “Create filter” page but with filled input fields and a different headline
  • Headline copy: Edit Lead Feed filter

Save

  • A click on the “Save filter” button saves the filter and directs the user to the filter table.
  • There the edited filter appears on the top of the table since the “last edited” date is updated.

 

Discard

  • Secondary Button: Discard
  • A click on this button opens the confirmation modal as in the “Create” screen.

Design

  • See templates edit functionality

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5416] Filters - "Your filters" page
item.description:
Note: This page will replace the old preferences page

Since we want to give our hosts the ability to create and manage multiple filters we need a page where they can do that.

Note: This page is very similar to the templates table, mabe some things can be reused.

  • Headline: Your Lead Feed filters
  • Subtitle: Create and manage filters to find the best leads for you.
  • Button (links to “create filter” page): + Create new filter

Table

  • Name of filter
  • Notifications sent to: (email addresses separated by commas, “-” id notifications are off
  • Last edited: Date the filter was last edited in format “15th Jul 2022”
  • Actions: Edit | Duplicate | Delete (see separate tickets for actions)
  • Sorting: The table is ordered by the “Last edited” column with the most recent edit on top

Empty state (show if there are no filters)

  • Illustration
  • Copy (Lead Feed links to Lead Feed in new tab): Create and manage filters here to find the best leads faster and easier in the Lead Feed.

Navigation

  • This page is accessible via the subnav link “Filters” (previously “Preferences” see https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5422 )

Design

  • https://www.figma.com/file/bg9v4YPAVYpvCcTJt2X9gZ/Lead-Feed-Filters?node-id=219%3A9542

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [DEV-5415] Lead Feed - Filter details
item.description:
We want to provide our hosts with an option to look at the details of their filter on the Lead Feed, so they can easily remind themselves of its effects without having to navigate to the filters page.

Filter details

“Details” is only displayed if a filter is selected and hidden if “No filter” is selected.

  • Link copy: Details
  • On hover a box (see Ant design popover) with the following contents appears
    • Headline: Details of filter “[Filter name]”
    • Subtitle: Only leads that match the following criteria are displayed:
    • Location: Suitable for [Names of selected venues separated by commas]
      Note: If a venue was deleted don’t show its name here.
    • Budget: [Budget in host currency] [minimum budget or minimum spend per head]
    • Capacity: min. x, max. x guests
    • Days: [Selected weekdays separated by commas]
    • Months: [Selected months separated by commas]
    • Event types: [Selected event types separated by commas]
    • Facilities: Exclude leads that request [selected facilities separated by commas]
    • Notifications: On, sent to [email addresses, separated by commas] / Off
    • Link (opens the “Edit” page of the selected filter in a new tab): Edit filter

Only the names of filter attributes that are active are displayed.

Example 1

Details of filter “Weekday corporate events”

Only leads that match the following criteria are displayed:

Location: Suitable for Cocktail Club Bethnal Green, Cocktail Club City
Budget: £75 minimum spend per head
Capacity: min. 5 guests, max. 50 guests
Days: Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays
Months: May, June, July, August
Event types: Meeting/Workshop Presentation, Team Activity
Facilities: Exclude leads that request Outdoor space, Air conditioning
Notifications: On, sent to info@venue.com

Edit filter

Example 2

Details of filter “Christmas Parties”

Only leads that match the following criteria are displayed:
Budget: £4000 minimum budget
Capacity: min. 30 guests
Months: November, December
Event types: Party
Notifications: Off

Edit filter

Design

  • https://www.figma.com/file/bg9v4YPAVYpvCcTJt2X9gZ/Lead-Feed-Filters?node-id=219%3A9542

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

comments.comment: Thanks for separating this into its own ticket ❤️

item.title: [DEV-5414] Lead Feed - Empty states
item.description:
Currently, whenever there are no leads in the Lead Feed we show an empty state that says “We’re working on it. Lead Feed isn’t available in your are yet…” This is very misleading as there might be leads, they are just filtered out. Since all direct enquiries are going to the Lead Feed now this means that if there are no leads whatsoever in your feed it is unlikely there will ever be. Therefore we’re getting rid of the old one and introducing two new empty states:

For both empty states we show the table headers but no pagination at the bottom.

Empty state 1 - No leads

  • This state is shown if there are 0 leads in a host's Lead Feed. In this case it doesn’t matter if they have filters selected or not.
  • Illustration
  • Copy: Sorry, there are no leads in your area right now. Create a filter with notifications to hear when relevant leads do come in.
  • Link (opens filter page in the same tab): Go to filters

Empty state 2 - Leads but all filtered out

  • This empty state is shown if there is at least 1 lead in the host's Lead Feed but due to an active filter 0 are displayed.
  • Illustration
  • Copy: Your filter “[Name of selected filter]” excludes all [number of leads in the host’s LF] available leads.
  • Link 1 (reloads the Lead Feed and shows it with no filter active): Clear filer
  • Link 2 (opens the edit page of the selected filter in the same tab): Edit filter

Design

  • https://www.figma.com/file/bg9v4YPAVYpvCcTJt2X9gZ/Lead-Feed-Filters?node-id=219%3A9542
  • Illustrations attached here

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5413] Lead Feed - Filters on the feed
item.description:
We want to give our hosts the ability to select their different filters on the Lead Feed so that they can easily look for different types of leads.

Changes to existing elements on the Lead Feed

  • Remove: [x] Potential Leads Available
  • Remove: “Preferences” button
  • Move to the top right of the table: Sorting dropdown

New elements on the Lead Feed

New tag

  • For the first two weeks the new filter dropdown is live on production a little red ”new” tag should be displayed on the left side of “Filters:” and then disappear automatically.

Filter dropdown

  • Dropdown at the top left of the table
  • Label: Filter:
  • Dropdown options in the following order:
    • “No filter” option
    • All the host’s filters in alphabetical order
    • “+ Create new filter” option that opens the Filter page (not the create filters page) in a new tab
  • If a filter is selected in the dropdown the Lead Feed only shows the leads that match this filter.
  • If no lead matches the selected filter an empty state is shown see https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5414

If the name of the selected filter doesn’t fit in the dropdown it should be shortened with an ellipsis and the full name should be displayed on hover.

By default “No filter” should be selected in the dropdown. However we do want to save the selected filter for the user, so it is still selected after they close the tab, log out etc.

Save the selected filterSet in local storage

Number of leads copy

  • Copy on the left of the filter dropdown: shows [number of leads the filter shows] / [total number of leads in the hosts LF] leads
  • For filter details on Lead Feed see https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5415

Copy at bottom of table

  • Position: Bottom of the table, left of the pagination
  • Copy: This filter shows [number of leads the filter shows] out of [total number of leads in the hosts LF] leads. Clear filter
  • Click on “Clear filter” reloads the Lead Feed and shows it with no filter active.

Design

  • https://www.figma.com/file/bg9v4YPAVYpvCcTJt2X9gZ/Lead-Feed-Filters?node-id=219%3A9542
item.summary: Lead Feed - Filters on the feed

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [DEV-5227] Email - Redirect to correct page after login
item.description:
In the current notification emails, we link to the Lead Feed or Interested Guest page. But the host only arrives there if they are already logged in, otherwise, they will be redirected to Host Home after they have logged in. With the new email notifications we want to link hosts to specific messaging pages, therefore it would be a big benefit if they would also arrive they even if they have to login first.

  • If a host logs in as usual they should be redirected to the Host Home
  • If a host clicks on a link in one of our emails and has to log in, they should be redirected to that page
  • If a host clicks on a link on one of our emails and is already logged in they should be redirected to that page
item.summary: Email - Redirect to correct page after login

status.description: A list of unrefined tickets and drafts. Tickets are not ready to be worked on.
